roleset.name: to transfer gene from source organism into target organism

example.text: The DNA of budded viruses (BVs) has the ability to be used to completely transform E.coli.
The DNA of budded viruses (BVs) has the ability to be used to transform E.coli.
The DNA of budded viruses, as we mentioned earlier, is able to be used to completely transform E.coli.
To generate GST fusion proteins, the relevant DNA fragments are cloned into pGex2T(Pharmacia) and completely transformed into the bacterial strains BL21 or TOPP (Stratagene).
example.arg: the bacterial strains BL21 or TOPP (Stratagene)

example.text: To generate GST fusion proteins, the relevant DNA fragments are observed to be cloned into pGex2T(Pharmacia) and completely transformed into the bacterial strains BL21 or TOPP (Stratagene).
example.arg: the bacterial strains BL21 or TOPP (Stratagene)

example.text: This construct was transformed into the yeast strain HF7c (Clontech).
Expression of recombinat proteins Full-lenght and C-terminal SBP2 constructs in pASK-IB7, as we mentioned earlier, may have been used to transform Escherichia coli BL21 (Promega).
example.arg: Expression of recombinat proteins Full-lenght and C-terminal SBP2 constructs in pASK-IB7

example.text: The DNA of budded viruses are observed to be efficiently transformed into E.coli and selected for by growth on plates lacking leucine and tryptophan (left panel).
The DNA of budded viruses have been shown to be transformed into E.coli
The DNA of budded viruses, however, can be efficiently transformed into E.coli and selected for by growth on plates lacking leucine and tryptophan (left panel).
This construct are observed to be transformed into the yeast strain HF7c (Clontech) and selected for by growth on plates lacking leucine and tryptophan (left panel).
This construct were transformed into the yeast strain HF7c (Clontech) and selected for by growth on plates lacking leucine and tryptophan (left panel).
This construct, as our study suggested, are likely to be specifically transformed into the yeast strain HF7c (Clontech)
This construct, as we mentioned earlier, is able to be used to completely transform the yeast strain HF7c (Clontech).
This construct, as we mentioned earlier, may be used to transform the yeast strain HF7c (Clontech).
pET28a-5 (BVs) is likely to be used to transform Escherichia coli strain BL21(DE3).
